security: This cable discusses a potential fugitive under narcotics indictment, Albert Larrain Maestre, and his alleged admission to involvement in bombings with Rosenthal. Revealing information about active investigations, sources of information, and operational contacts (AMCLEVE/15) could compromise ongoing law enforcement or intelligence activities. Specifically, the cable requests station traces, which may expose sensitive intelligence gathering methods. Quoting directly: "REQUEST STATION TRACES ALBERT LARRAIN MAESTRE... REQUEST STATION COMMENT ANCLEVE-15 EVER RECEIVE SUCH ADMISSION FROM LARRAIN MAESTRE."
summary: A cable discusses Albert Larrain Maestre, a fugitive under narcotics indictment who allegedly admitted involvement in bombings with Rosenthal, and requests station traces; additionally it explores AMCLEVE/15's connection to the case and FBI involvement.
summary_one_paragraph: This cable details queries from the Justice Department regarding AMCLEVE/15's contact with Frank "Lefty" Rosenthal, specifically questioning AMCLEVE/15's sources and transactions related to procurement of arms and munitions. The cable references a fugitive, Albert Larrain Maestre, who is allegedly involved in bombings and is under narcotics indictment, and it requests information about whether AMCLEVE/15 received any admissions from Maestre regarding these activities. The communication also explores AMCLEVE/15's reporting of events to the FBI, seeking to clarify discrepancies between JMWAVE records and information provided by AMCLEVE/15.
title: AMCLEVE/15 Contact with Frank "Lefty" ROSENTHAL
sender: Chief of Station, JMWAVE; William V. Bros (C/WHD); R.A. Ortman (WH/COG/NO). DE WH/COG
